abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews Millbrook Winery's 1998 Tocal Friulano white wine and Proprietor's Special Reserve 1998 cabernet franc; photo (M)

block.p: For New Yorkers, Millbrook, a serene semirural Dutchess County community, is both a destination for leisurely wine excursions and the brand name of a line of wines.
Since 1981, when Millbrook Vineyards and Winery produced its first commercial vintage, it has been the Hudson Valley's outstanding winery and one of the state's best.
For New Yorkers, Millbrook, a serene semirural Dutchess County community, is both a destination for leisurely wine excursions and the brand name of a line of wines.
Since 1981, when Millbrook Vineyards and Winery produced its first commercial vintage, it has been the Hudson Valley's outstanding winery and one of the state's best.

John W. Dyson and his wife, Kathe, own the 130-acre estate. Though he is well known as a vintner, politics has been his other life; for a time, he was Rudolph W. Giuliani's deputy mayor for economic development.
As State Commerce Commissioner in Gov. Hugh L. Carey's administration, Mr. Dyson, a Democrat, created the ''I Love New York'' campaign.

Today, he also produces wine in California and Tuscany. Millbrook's aromatic '98 Tocai Friulano, a sprightly light-bodied white based on an Italian grape and long a food-oriented feature of its portfolio, sells for about $13.
The buttery-oaky, light-bodied simple '97 chardonnay, in a crisp Burgundian style version that offers not an iota of California-style fatness, is about $14.
The opulent, jammy, smooth, almost-sweet, mouth-filling Proprietor's Special Reserve '98 cabernet franc is about $19.

In Manhattan, Millbrook wines, which can be special-ordered, have been carried by Sherry-Lehmann, 679 Madison Avenue (61st Street); Morrell & Company, 1 Rockefeller Plaza; and Columbus Circle Liquor, 1780 Broadway (57th Street).

Open daily from noon to 5 P.M. for tastings and tours, the hillside winery, in a spacious whitewashed Dutch hip-roofed dairy barn, commands inspiring rural vistas. It is situated near the junction of the Shunpike and Wing Road in Millbrook; for information: (800) 662-9463; www.millbrookwine.com.
